Description: Part of bowl and foot of a pottery cup; low, slightly flaring ring foot with broad stand-ring; interior, black-glazed with decoration in added white and red: a white dotted rosette at centre surrounded by red and white circles; to the outside further added decoration of which only some white dot-rosettes are preserved. Underside of foot reserved, with glaze rings.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 211, no. 13)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.780)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4647 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
